page.title: 03Ecology.Hoo area
page.content: The landscape of the area is gently undulating,with the Upper Deben Valley running through it.Most of the land is arable but has water meadows on either side of the river.These meadows attract wild geese,swans & many other water birds such as herons & kingfishers.The river water is clean & supports a variety of fish-fishing is enjoyed as a sport.Kingcups,watercress,wild hostas, irises & other water-loving plants grow in profusion.During heavy rains the river often overflows,covering the fields and flooding the roads. There are several small areas of deci- duous woodland-some coppiced-used gene- rally for the rearing of gamebirds.As well as reared pheasants there are many wild ones,also partridges,a few woodcock & snipe.Birds of prey include kestrels,sparrowhawks & occasionally peregrine falcons.
